storyInfo: Theresis receives an invitation from a Victorian duke. Babel's conflict with the Military Commission breaks out into full-scale war, bringing an end to two centuries of peace in Kazdel.

attributes.text: Your Highness Theresis, Regent of Kazdel, Commanding General of the Military Commission,
Wandering scholars have brought back tales of a new nomadic city on the rise in the distant desert.
The fires of the ancient furnace continue to burn, and the once-scattered mercenaries have flocked to one banner, to the city walls that grow taller by the day.
Your strength and reputation have caught the attention of the Duke of Cavendish.
You have changed the way we view the Sarkaz tribes. Perhaps now is the time to set prejudices aside, and engage in sincere sharing and cooperation that would be beneficial to us both.
I, the Duke of Cavendish, hereby invite you to visit my demesne, where we may sit and parley.
Our venerable empire has use for you and your brave warriors.

attributes.content: Winter 1091
One more time... I have to do this...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No point talking about curing Oripathy, if I can't do something so simple...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Arghâ€”
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Still no good... *pant* *pant*
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Excuse me, why don't you put that medkit down? Leave this stuff to us.
attributes.name: Field Soldier

attributes.content: A-Alright...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Some time in the gym would do you good, once you've recovered.
attributes.name: Field Soldier

attributes.content: At present, there is no way for you to match the physical prowess of a Terran through training.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your talents are better employed outside of manual labor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know. It's just that, you know, I have my pride too...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You've looked on edge since that day.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm thinking about... Theresa.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Traveling alone to a city under enemy control isn't the most logical course of action for a leader.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The warriors with her may be outstanding, but they're not enough to protect her in the face of an entire army.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The King of Sarkaz enjoys unimaginable status in Sarkaz tradition, and Theresa's own achievements are well-recognized. The Military Commission would not act rashly.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But Victoria's invitation to Kazdel cannot be taken as a sign of goodwill. It means that Terra's powers have once again set their sights on Kazdel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Theresa needs to go to Kazdel and make it clear that she will not permit Kazdel to become embroiled in another war.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if I know how the Military Commission and Babel came into being...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: In my understanding, the Sarkaz can hardly afford an internal conflict that could drain them of what little resources they have left. They have enough to deal with as it is.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: They have a complicated history, and that brings different attitudes towards outsiders.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Sarkaz people have a right to choose the path they believe is correct: Theresis's, or Theresa's.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Looks like we've got a lot to deal with besides Oripathy.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: There's a big difference between knowing and understanding, I guess. Looks like there's much I still need to learn about the history of Terra.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This time, you'll be the one to guide me, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Of course.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: All we can do right now is make sure that the Oripathy patients at Rhodes Island have access to proper treatmentâ€”
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: What's going onâ€”
attributes.name: Field Soldier

attributes.content: An attack? Now?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Word is Her Highness has set out.
attributes.name: Grim Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Listen up! We exalt only Her Highness. Destroy Babel, and she will return to the embrace of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Grim Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: If we're branded traitors, so be it. But the Regent must not be hindered at this crucial juncture. Kazdel will take back all that we have lost.
attributes.name: Grim Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: May the Sarkaz be united as Her Highness wills.
attributes.name: Grim Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Scar Market, Kazdel
Her Highness is coming...
attributes.name: Cold Mercenary

attributes.content: Her Highness? The one who's still on the run?
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: His or Her, it's not your place to talk shit.
attributes.name: Cold Mercenary

attributes.content: Hah. Say, did you take that job?
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: Wouldn't pass up an opportunity like this if it's the last thing I did. Londinium, that den of scum.
attributes.name: Cold Mercenary

attributes.content: They say the columns in the Feline palace are covered in gold, and the nobles walk on floors paved with glowing stones.
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, capital of a great empire! A commission from a grand duke! There's gonna be so much money!
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: It's been a while, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: It's been so long since you last visited. Why not sit down and catch up for a bit?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You're sending mercenaries to Londinium.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Now, now, I must object to that accusation.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: People just follow the money, and it leads to what the Regent has provided in Londinium.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You're dragging Kazdel into another war.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: 'Dragging Kazdel into another war.' Have you been fooling around with those dreamers at Babel for so long that you've forgotten what it means to be a Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Since when have the Sarkaz been apart from war?!
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The giant's hand lunges forward. Ascalon is surprised to find that she cannot avoid his fist.
...Grr.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Seeing the future is hard. Seeing through what you will do next, less so.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Did you think you were the child of destiny, so special that you could bridge the rift between the siblings?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Think back to the day when you saw them for the first time...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: When you skinned that young mangler and followed the trail of blood through the wilderness, until you walked into a storm and met the King of Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: How did you...?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: 'How did I know?' Are you surprised, Ascalon?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I saw the prophecy and led the tribe on the wastes into the storm that day with game. You happened to be the one who lived.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: No one truly understands prophecy. No one can interfere with the future. But I wanted to catch the tail of fate... I wanted to make prophecy.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Theresis didn't kill you. Instead, he kept you and raised you. Maybe he wanted to tempt fate.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: But you never changed, in all these years. You're still that poor, lost child on the wastes.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Have patience, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You're not a threat to me yet. And I have higher hopes for you than this.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Master saidâ€”
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: 'Your blade points at all the enemies of the Sarkaz.'
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Theresis raised you to be a deathmonger, yet you understand less about him than a warmonger like me.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Did you think Theresis would be content to be some puppet for those dukes? Spare your breath, if you don't know the full extent of his plan.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I'm curious, how would you stand before Theresis, if he was sitting in the room behind me right now?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You're simply repeating the words of others, on behalf of the one behind you.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You seem to have put a lot of thought into this war.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How many hostiles?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Exact numbers unclear. We've detected hostiles both in front of and behind us. A lot of them...
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Whether it was Theresis's intention or not, the other generals of the Military Commission seem intent to crush Babel while Theresa is absent.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That way, the Sarkaz won't have a choice.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How many combat personnel do we have?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The best soldiers went into negotiations with Her Highness. A good part of the remaining ones have been assigned to the supply convoys. We only have less than one third of our normal force.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: At the very least, we need to break through the roadblock ahead...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'll take command.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If, as you said, this attack was launched by only a few members of the Military Commission, then they're undoubtedly planning to get this done in one go.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: We can't let them set the pace.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Find out where their lines are thin. Disrupt their rhythm, and we'll be safe.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Have you fought a war before, Dr. {@nickname}?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Not the flesh and blood kind... but I've been trained.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'm able to reconstruct a battlefield as a computable data model.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Take the front line, Kal'tsit. I know you'll be able to protect us.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Welcome to the Scar Market, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Things must be busy here lately.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No need going against the will of the many. Am I right, Your Highness?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The voices of the few are worth respecting too.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Many know nothing of what's happening in the lands beyond. Their lives will be turned upside-down. They'll be without a home once again.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm just a humble merchant. My business only stretches so far.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Mercenaries seek to sell their lives. I seek to make money. That's why I always respect the positions of my big clients.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Then I'll talk to your biggest client. The one in the room behind you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness should go no further.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Since when have you started meddling in the affairs of Kazdel, Scareye?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: All the more reason I can't let you go further.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Please, don't make things difficult for Scareye, Your Highness.
You understand that there's only one way this can go, if you and the Regent come face-to-face here.
...Confessarius.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I beg Your Highness's pardon.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Looks like you've made a decision.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Is this Theresis's position?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: He has decided to abandon our city?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Not abandon. Take a step forward, to go on a long expedition away from home, that's all.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: You have made us stagnant. We want to progress.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: The Confessarius is right.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: I still remember when you and General Theresis came here for the first time. Even fate itself stepped aside for the two of you, when you stood together.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: But look at the people here now, when Kazdel is divided.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: You can still command any Sarkaz to your will as their King. You could kill all of us who stand here right now. But why not ask them if they're still willing to follow your dream?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The bustling Scar Market has lost its usual commotion. Scattered mercenaries stow their weapons and stand with heads bowed in reverence.
In their eyes is silence, but the King of Sarkaz hears the voices of their hearts clearly.
Uncertainty, excitement, desire, anger.
Most of you have made up your minds.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then there is no point for me to try to stop you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: One of the Sarkaz suddenly kneels.
He has not changed his mind. He has not turned away from the temptation of Theresis's plan.
He simply feels a sense of guilt towards Theresa, one of the Six Heroes, their King who rebuilt Kazdel.
Kneel if you feel you should. Neither General Theresis nor Lord Scareye will fault you.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Ah... this ancient gesture signifies more than just fealty. I am more familiar with its other meaning...
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Penitence.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: ...Qui'sartuÅ¡taj.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have you found the meaning of your name?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Not yet, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: Then forgive their sins as you must forgive yours.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresis and I will carry all your sins.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: As you bid.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: I bow to you, King of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Confessarius

attributes.content: In millennia of Sarkaz history, it has always been an honor for warriors to go to war with their Kings.
They have tasted struggle and glory, picked themselves up from the bloodied soil...
For the Kings of Sarkaz always stood in front of them, never abandoning their people.
Where the Kings point, that is where home is, where cities will emerge from the earth.
Now, though, they have abandoned their King.
I promised a home of peace and safety, where Sarkaz will be forever free from war.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Before I set foot here, I had a sliver of hope that perhaps someone would follow me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I saw fire in your eyes.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I saw the city that none of you had seen with your own eyes burn.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The ancient city comes in many shapes and forms in your eyes.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A city of desire, a city of hatred, a city of wealth, a city of glory...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You all believe you will plunder what you have longed for in that unfamiliar land.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That's why I changed my mind. I decided to see Kazdel's bravest warriors off.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kazdel will embark on a path of conquest for the first time in many years.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I honor you, even though I never wanted you to take this step.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You answered Theresis's call and dove into yet another campaign of hatred.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Death awaits you far away from home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yet you still choose to leave our home and go to Londinium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The sorrowful King of Sarkaz walks among her people, who bow their heads to avoid her gaze.
Yet their determination does not waver, even if it means defying the King.
'We're going.' 'We're going.'
Voices rise and fall, as though the warriors are singing an elegy for themselves as they go to death.
We exalt Your Highness, but we cannot follow you anymore.
attributes.name: Unnamed Mercenary

attributes.content: The Regent promises that Londinium will be a new start.
attributes.name: Decorated Mercenary

attributes.content: There lies the Sarkaz future.
attributes.name: Sobbing Mercenary

attributes.content: There lies our future!
attributes.name: Loud Mercenary

attributes.content: Take care of yourselves, my warriors.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even if you will never return to Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The white figure passes through the parted crowd. The King's people are unmoved by her words.
They no longer follow the King they once exalted.
The other possibility for her people, the home full of flowers that she strived to build, did not come in time for the Sarkaz.
General...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You knew this day would come.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Hesitate, and all we've worked for will be for naught.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Her Highness did not hesitate. Neither should we.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Make your preparations, then, Manfred.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Do not forget the feelings that burn within you, here and now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: No matter what they are.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Secret Entrance of Scar Market, Kazdel
No need to be down, Ascalon.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: More will join us when Babel grows strong enough to provide shelter for more people.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We're being followed.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Your Highnessâ€”!
Wait, Ascalon. She's not hostile.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Whoa, that was a hard hit. Is that a sleeve-blade?
Anyway, Your Highness, I would like to leave with you, if that's okay with you.
Thank you. What's your name?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Julie.
A nice name. One that's not often used by mercenaries. Did you make it up yourself?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No... I don't have a name. Someone else gave it to me. She said having a name gives one a sense of belonging.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: She's right.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Why not follow the rest of them to Londinium?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I've had enough of fighting. She says Your Highness will bring about a life where we don't have to fight anymore. That's why I came to check it out for her.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I wanted to challenge you before deciding whether to go with you, but I didn't even have the guts to raise my sword when you stood before me.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: You're a strong warrior, that's for sure.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I wouldn't say that about myself when I'm standing in front of you.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: At least I can be sure that she wasn't playing me for a fool when she said you were once a great hero of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: A reason so simple it's hard to believe.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The red-haired mercenary scratches her head.
Well... I guess I liked the way you talked just now. Not sure I understood most of it, though.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Where's your friend? She can come too.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: She's already here. Her sword and her clothes... may be a little loose-fitting, though.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: She was a strong warrior. Felt a little like this one over here.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I'm a little something of a tailor. I could hem it for you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There's no need. I'm used to it.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Let's go, then, Julie.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: One moment, please, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: There are other mercenaries here who want to go with you.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Theresa looks toward the dark exit of the Scar Market, and sees a swaying speck of flame.
One speck becomes two, two become three, and many more emerge from the darkness. The first torch-carrying mercenary steps into the sunlight and sees the white figure standing on top of the hill.
He points forward and walks toward Theresa without looking back.
More and more follow him, the line seemingly without end.
Just because we're used to battle doesn't mean we're willing to bury ourselves in a campaign with no end in sight. If there's another way to live, many of us are willing to take it.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I heard some people are secretly recruiting the willing in Kazdel. There may be some there ready to join us, although the journey through the wilderness would be a tough one...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I'll make arrangements.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Let's go, Julie. We have a lot to do.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There are plenty of people for us to house, after all.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You're back.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: They've retreated. Outstanding work, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Who...?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: A group of medics hurry through the corridor, carrying several stretchers. Kal'tsit turns to block them from the Doctor's sight.
The enemy was essentially making suicide attacks. It was inevitable that there would be casualties as we broke through.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We lost fewer than we had any right to expect.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How many did we lose?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: There was nothing wrong with how you commanded the operation. You don't need to be involved in the cleanup.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit! We're running low on plasma.
attributes.name: Medic

attributes.content: I'll deal with coordination and surgery.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The medics have already gone. The Doctor is not sure whether the terrifying scene just now was a figment of the imagination, but the smell of blood simply would not got away.
A sense of dizziness.
I'm able to reconstruct a battlefield as a computable data model.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But it's not numbers that fight a war.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Living, breathing people are fighting for their survival. How long as it been since I...?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: First time seeing the blood and gore?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: ...You could say that.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: We didn't have so many lives to waste in the wars I fought in the past.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Treat yourself to a sweet drink. It will make you feel better. I speak from experience.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: It's all thanks to your command that we were able to triumph against overwhelming odds.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Are your battles always like this?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No, this was one of the easy ones.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: I'll gladly entrust my life to you, if it means our future battles will be so easy.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Is war really the only way?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You're not the first to ask that question.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: But this attack is only a sign of things to come. No one knows what the future holds.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: I have great expectations of you, our tactical genius.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The history books would record that the two Sarkaz rulers declared war on each other in the winter of 1091, causing open hostilities to break out between the Military Commission and Babel.
For the Sarkaz themselves, however, the civil war had begun in 1086, when isolated conflicts started to escalate rapidly.
The two centuries of peace that Kazdel had enjoyed have come to an end.
